meanings.definition: A type of protein produced by a single type of immune cell.
meanings.sent1: The monokine helps the immune system fight off infections.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying how monokines can enhance immune responses.
meanings.sent3: The monokine protein threw a party for all the immune cells.
meanings.sent4: Like a superhero, the monokine protein swoops in to protect the body.
meanings.sent5: The monokine protein acts like a commander, directing immune cells to battle.

meanings.definition: A signaling molecule that regulates immune responses.
meanings.sent1: When released, the monokine sends messages to other immune cells.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are researching the effects of different monokines on the immune system.
meanings.sent3: The monokine signaling molecule danced around, controlling immune responses.
meanings.sent4: In the body's orchestra, the monokine plays the conductor, guiding immune reactions.
meanings.sent5: The monokine molecule whispers instructions to the immune cells, guiding their actions.
